name: hardwood forestry, eucalyptus ssp., planted forest management | cleft timber, measured as dry mass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21639/documentation

;This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of eucalyptus wood fuel (fresh matter) from planted forest management as the prevailing management practices in a region that concentrates wood for energy purposes production in Brazil. Assumed wood basic density of 529 kg.m³-1. The actitivity lasts 14 years with 2 harvesting events. MAI is 50 m³/ha.year-1 in the first harvest and 40 m³/ha.year-1 in the second, resulting in a total of 633.8 m³.ha-1. Final moisture content of storage is 25%. The total amount of mineral fertilizers (N-P-K) and pesticides (glyphosate, sufluramide and flumioxazine) apllied are 131 kg N.ha-1; 55 kg P2O5.ha-1; 171 kg K2O.ha-1 and 17.6 kg pesticides.ha-1, respectively. Specie mainly cultivated is E. urograndis, in a rate of 1666 seedlings.hectare-1.;;;;Source: BRUSCHINELLI (2014) [https://www.embrapa.br/busca-de-noticias/-/noticia/2301345/projeto-analisa-desempenho-socioambiental-da-producao-de-eucalipto] access 10 mar 2016;The process steps are showed below:;Source: Barrantes (2016), Master Thesis (not published yet);References:;;Canals, 2003: Contributions to LCA Methodology for Agricultural Systems. Site-dependency and soil degradation impact assessment: http://www.tdx.cat/handle/10803/3155;Nemecek & Schnetzer: Methods of assessment of direct field emissions for LCIs of agricultural production systems, Data v3.0 (2011): http://www.ecoinvent.org/fileadmin/talkpages/pages/01-01-crop-production/01_crop_production_-_direct_field_emissions___natural_resources_v1.1.pdf;Novais & Smyth (1999) Fósforo em solo e planta em condições tropicais. Viçosa: Universidade Federal de Viçosa, p. 399.;Novaes, Renan M. L. et al. (2017) Estimating 20-year land use change and derived CO2 emissions associated with crops, parture and forestry in Brazil and each of its 27 states. Global Change Biology, 2017, 1-13.;Nemecek T., Bengoa X., Lansche J., Mouron  P., Riedener E., Rossi V. & Humbert S. (2015) Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products. Version 3.0, July 2015. World Food LCA Database (WFLDB). Quantis and Agroscope, Lausanne and Zurich, Switzerland.

Activity starts with the establishment of the eucalyptus plantation in the first year, covers the maintenance during six years and the first harvesting in the seventh. Eucalyptus sprouts are conducted to regrowth and the same process is repited. Considering both rotation periods, the operations are: 
1) starting from the seedling cultivation in a greenhouse of the region and transport to the field, liming, pit opening and seedling planting; 2) starting from the regrowth of the plants in the field after the first rotation is finished (there is no seedlings cultivation and planting activities); 
1) the 6 years after establishment cover 3 fertilising, weed chemical control and ant control; 2) in the second rotation this 6 years cover just 1 fertilizing, weed chemical control and ant control;
In both situations 1) and 2), rotation period is 7 years, while in situation 2) the yield is 20% lower.

The processing of wood is not performed as the final product are logs for energy. This activity ends with the logs at the forest road and includes time for drying in air before transportation. The dataset does not include the seedling production and the infrastructure building, just the maintenance of firebreaks (two times in 14 years) and forest roads (annually).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/021:Silviculture and other forestry activities/0210:Silviculture and other forestry activities

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period of the most of the data collected for this dataset.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for the state of São Paulo, in Brazil.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of wood to generate energy inside industries. Small scale of plantations (inside Brazilian proportions - 5,000 ha) with low level of mechanization. Most operations are manual except the pit opening and harvesting operations. Machines used in the harvesting step are: chainsaw to fell trees, tractor coupled to a trailer auto loadable to extract the wood from the field to the forest boarder and forestry loader to load the transportation vehicle.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Carbon content is based on ecoinvent database
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The main source of data for forestry inputs and operations is a project conducted by Embrapa Florestas, Embrapa Meio Ambiente (CNPMA) and Universidade Tecnológica Federal do Paraná (UTFPR). Data are provided by producers located in the south of São Paulo state. First information was collected with 9 companies and validation data was proceeded with two of them.
Emissions from the forestry process are estimated according to Nemecek and Schnetzer (2011) and Canals (2003).

exchanges.description: 1 kg of dry mass, including bark. The total yield is 633,8 m³.ha-1 with a final moisture content at storage of 25%.

exchanges.description:
"All pesticides applied for crop production were assumed to end up as emissions to the soil. The amounts of pesticides used as inputs were thus simultaneously calculated as outputs (emissions to agricultural soil)", as recomended by Nemecek & Schnetzer (2011), "2.9 EMISSIONS OF PESTICIDES TO AGRICULTURAL SOIL" (page 21).
This exchange represents the input of sulfluramide.
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

flow.name: Pesticides, unspecified
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to soil/agricultural

exchanges.description: NH3 emissions from applied mineral fertilisers are calculated according to Agrammon model available in EEA/EMEP (2013), page 35. Constant emission factors are: 1.1% for ammonium sulphate, 3% for ammonium nitrate and 9.3% for mono-ammonium phosphate; in soils with pH<=7 (brazilian conditions).

exchanges.description: Due to phosphorus low mobility in Brazilian soils, its emissions through leaching and run-off were disregarded (Novais & Smyth, 1999). Only P emission by water erosion through surface water was considered. They are calculated through the showed mathematical relation that is in accordance with "2.3.3 Phorsphorous Emissions Through Water Erosion to Surface Water" Nemecek and Schnetzer (2011).

Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).
